messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] new and letting go of math
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/28/2000 2:14:09 PM, NumoAstro@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/28/2000 2:14:09 PM, NumoAstro@... writes:

<<The other day he watched 5 videos in a row and I was panic stricken
that he'd never get up from in front of the television. He was watching
about elephants in africa, austrialia and the great barrier reef, madeline
and winnie the pooh, then back onto a gorilla tape.... So I have to ask
myself... Would I be this concerned and gripped if he were sitting at the
kitchen table with math school books for 5 hours... No of course not... I
think I had to deschool myself first and accept that this was going to be ok
no matter what.>>

I agree. We have some video viewing jags here.

I think the one-hour a day recommendations for TV viewing are aimed at kids
who have already spent 6 hours listening to a teacher lecture. I think of
much of the TV that we watch here as a substitute for that classroom sitting
time. (LOL -- we are getting our "seatwork" done.) We're watching mostly
PBS stuff.

Betsy
